subject: Technology
title: Satellite TV: Beaming From Space
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Satellite TV: Beaming From Space.

hook.text: In 1962, Telstar relayed the first live TV signal across the Atlantic. Two continents watched each other in real time.

buildup.text: Communication satellites orbit Earth, receiving TV signals from ground stations and beaming them to dish antennas worldwide.

discovery.text: Satellite TV brought television to remote areas where cable couldn't reach: farms, islands, and developing nations.

twist.text: Early satellite dishes were over 10 feet wide. Neighbors called them eyesores. Homeowner associations banned them.

climax.text: DirecTV and Dish Network miniaturized dishes and challenged cable's monopoly, driving down prices for consumers.

punchline.text: TV signals from space brought entertainment to every corner of the planet.

quiz.question: What was Telstar's significance in television history?
options: It was the first color TV channel
It relayed the first live TV signal across the Atlantic Ocean
